reviews.review_msg: SFU needs to find a better Punjabi teacher.  Parvinder runs her class like a Master in India would lol  She is top down and doesn't respond to student feedback well.  She tries to rationalize her assignments that require way too much work for an intro language class.   She has stuff on culture but you aren't allowed an opinion on it.  Opt out.

Not very good at introducing grammar or teaching it clearly. Course package was full of mistakes. Get penalized if you use words that are not bolded from the course pack even though she includes them in the exam herself. The presentation dragged everyone's mark. She didn't balance beginners and native speakers well. Avoid Punjabi at SFU!

Parvinder makes a 100 level language course unnecessarily difficult. At first the assignments are reasonable but in the second half of the term, the assignments were definitely more for an advanced level language class. One of the assignments dropped everyones grades a lot and she had to justify herself instead of listening to the students. Avoid!
